skill.name: chrome-extension-icons
skill.description: Search and generate icons for Chrome browser extensions. Automatically downloads SVG icons from Iconify (275,000+ free icons), converts them to required PNG sizes (16x16, 32x32, 48x48, 128x128), and updates manifest.json configuration. Use when the user mentions "extension icon", "browser extension icon", "chrome icon", "add icon to extension", "generate icon for extension", or when working with Chrome extension manifest.json icon setup. Supports color customization, local SVG conversion, and batch generation for multiple projects.

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate icon generation tool for Chrome extensions. All detected patterns are false positives: documentation examples trigger command pattern detection, network requests are to the documented Iconify API, and filesystem operations are standard file writes to user-specified directories. No credential access, exfiltration, or malicious behavior present.

low_findings.title: Network requests to external API
low_findings.description: The script makes HTTPS requests to api.iconify.design to search for and download icons. This is documented and expected behavior for a legitimate icon generation tool.

low_findings.title: Filesystem write access in user directories
low_findings.description: The script writes PNG files to user-specified output directories and modifies manifest.json. This is necessary for icon generation.

content.value_statement: Chrome extensions require icons in 4 specific sizes for the toolbar, management page, and Chrome Web Store. This skill automates the process by searching Iconify library, converting SVG to PNG, and updating manifest.json in seconds.
actual_capabilities: Search 275,000+ icons from Iconify library by keyword
Download SVG icons and convert to PNG at 16x16, 32x32, 48x48, and 128x128 sizes
Apply custom colors to icons using hex color codes
Convert local SVG files to Chrome extension format
Batch generate icons for multiple projects
Automatically update manifest.json with icon paths
limitations: Works only with PNG format (Chrome requirement)
Color customization limited to single-color icons
Requires network access to Iconify API for cloud icons
Does not create new icon designs from scratch

best_practices: Show icon preview URLs before generating so users can confirm the design
Always verify PNG files were created successfully after generation
Inform users when manifest.json is being created versus updated

Assuming the first search result is always the best option
Skipping verification that files were created correctly

faq.question: What icon sizes does this skill generate?
faq.answer: It creates all 4 required sizes: 16x16 for toolbar, 32x32 for taskbar, 48x48 for management page, and 128x128 for Chrome Web Store.

faq.question: Can I use my own logo instead of Iconify icons?
faq.answer: Yes, use the convert command with --input flag to specify a local SVG file. The script will convert it to PNG at all required sizes.

faq.question: Does this work with existing manifest.json files?
faq.answer: Yes, the script reads your existing manifest.json and updates the icons field without removing other configuration.

faq.question: Is my data sent anywhere besides Iconify?
faq.answer: No, icons are downloaded from Iconify API and all file operations occur locally. No user data is collected or transmitted.

faq.question: What if the Iconify API is down?
faq.answer: The script includes retry logic with exponential backoff. If it fails repeatedly, it suggests using a local SVG file instead.

faq.question: How is this different from other icon tools?
faq.answer: This skill specifically targets Chrome extension requirements with the correct sizes and automatic manifest.json updates, saving manual configuration steps.
